Headings

There are three available headings:

  • h1
  • h2
  • h3

The h2 heading can have an additional class of text__title.

h1: Main heading. Use in a hero block

h2: Secondary heading. Use in a blog post

h2: Section title. Has a special class, use as an element heading

h3: Small heading. Use as a sub title in a text element.

<h1>h1: Main heading. Use in a hero block</h1>
<h2>h2: Secondary heading. Use in a blog post</h2>
<h2 class="text__title">h2: Section title. Has a special class, use as an element heading</h2>
<h3>h3: Small heading. Use as a sub title in a text element.</h3>

Text

Text is marked up with p tags. An optional class of text__standout can be added to a surrounding div element.

Paragraph text. Donec gravida scelerisque massa. Vivamus sollicitudin enim at nisl mattis auctor. Suspendisse vitae aliquam nibh. Proin convallis vel nibh id pulvinar. Aliquam et sodales diam, non pellentesque turpis. Suspendisse potenti.

Standout paragraph. Duis lobortis id est ac tristique.

<p>Paragraph text. Donec gravida scelerisque massa. Vivamus sollicitudin enim at nisl mattis auctor. Suspendisse vitae aliquam nibh. Proin convallis vel nibh id pulvinar. Aliquam et sodales diam, non pellentesque turpis. Suspendisse potenti.</p>
<hr>
<div class="text__standout">
    <p>Standout paragraph. Duis lobortis id est ac tristique.</p>
</div>

Lists

Lists come in two flavours. An ordinary bulleted list and a list with checks for bullets.

  • The ordinary list is a simple unordered list ul. Each li element contains a text marked up with p tags.
  • The checked list needs a class of list-with-checks.

  • Bullet point

  • Bullet point

  • Bullet point

  • Bullet point

  • Bullet point

    Bullet point explanation. Vestibulum vestibulum odio at finibus rutrum. Curabitur aliquam suscipit libero, quis pretium tellus molestie ac.

  • Bullet point

  • Bullet point

<ul>
    <li><p>Bullet point</p></li>
    <li><p>Bullet point</p></li>
    <li><p>Bullet point</p></li>
</ul>

<hr>

<ul class="list-with-checks">
    <li><p>Bullet point</p></li>
    <li>
        <p>Bullet point</p>
        <p>Bullet point explanation. Vestibulum vestibulum odio at finibus rutrum. Curabitur aliquam suscipit libero, quis pretium tellus molestie ac.</p>
    </li>
    <li><p>Bullet point</p></li>
    <li><p>Bullet point</p></li>
</ul>

Blockquote

A blockquote is marked up with the blockquote tag. Inside the quote uses p tags. The author of the quote is marked up with a cite tag with a class of capitals.

Donec gravida scelerisque massa. Vivamus sollicitudin enim at nisl mattis auctor. Suspendisse vitae aliquam nibh. Proin convallis vel nibh id pulvinar. Aliquam et sodales diam, non pellentesque turpis. Suspendisse potenti.

Julius Ceasar, Emperor 
<blockquote>
    <p>Donec gravida scelerisque massa. Vivamus sollicitudin enim at nisl mattis auctor. Suspendisse vitae aliquam nibh. Proin convallis vel nibh id pulvinar. Aliquam et sodales diam, non pellentesque turpis. Suspendisse potenti.</p>
    <cite class="capitals">Julius Ceasar, Emperor</cite>
</blockquote>

Blog

The blog elements have a few tags and classes specific or them.

  • The time tag contains the post date.
  • The title is marked up with an h2 element and a class of post__title.
  • The Read more link has a post__link class.

Month 99, YEAR

Blog post title

Read more

<time>Month 99, YEAR</time>
<h2 class="post__title"><a href="#" rel="bookmark">Blog post title</a></h2>
<p><a class="post__link" href="#" rel="bookmark">Read more</a></p>
